intro: Camissonia cardiophylla subsp. robusta, commonly known as the robust camissonia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of fleshy, ovate leaves. The plant produces showy, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky soils and is often found in coastal scrub habitats. Due to its specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
